review_text: The Hive has literally EVERYTHING you need besides clothing! We have not stayed anywhere else with so many amenities. The community of Lagro is very small and peaceful with beautiful surroundings. The snacks, condiments, coffee/tea, and s'mores supplies available in the kitchen was such a blessing! We unfortunately weren't there long enough to take advantage of such nice amenities. The provided ziploc bags were a lifesaver since we forgot to bring some!! The beds were quite comfortable...my parents wanted to take theirs home! Thank you for the opportunity to enjoy your home, Barb! We will be back and for sure plan days to just stay out in Largo!!

review_text: Highly recommend Barb's home. In over a decade of AirBnB/VRBO rentals, this ranks as one of the top places we've stayed. The kitchen was the best stocked we have experienced. Between the pots and pans, spices, dishes, and silverware, there wasn't anything else we could have needed. The coffee/hot beverage bar was amazing, so many choices. They have done a phenomenal job updating a 1930s-era home so that it has all of the modern amenities without losing any of the period charm. The decorating is great, so many things to look at. We were able to spend some time in Lagro and everyone was very friendly and welcoming. Thank you for sharing your home.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Spacious, pristine, simple, charming, and everything we needed for our getaway from it all stay! Misty replied to any questions almost immediately! Mattress was softer than we were used to, so we were surprised at how comfortable it actually was - and the bedding was so cozy! The pond and woods trails provided an entertaining variety of nature for curious nature buffs like me. A beautiful, serene place. I plan to bring my daughter and her girls here soon! Tip: the bathroom is done in an industrial theme. It has a concrete floor that gets slippery when wet. There are a couple of bath mats on the floor and nice-sized non-skid mats in the shower. Those with falling or balance issues might want to bring flip-flops or shower shoes for extra precaution. We usually camp in our camper when we travel but love this place so much, we'll likely make this an annual (at least) to come visit.

review_text:
This house is quaint and has a ton of amenities within walking distance and a very cool but small downtown area.
The YMCA- $20 daily drop in if youâ€™re a non member.
Inclusive Park with handicap access, right behind the Y.
Oh My Cakes! Great bakery.
Farmers market.
Theater that had a showing of Spider-Man.
_________________________________
As far as the property itself, the sleeping accommodations were comfortable and clean- definitely bring your own pillows.
The narrow staircase does have carpet on it, and there is a step that is weakly enforced and I did not feel very comfortable on that. There also was a nail that poked through the carpet on that step.
The living room is comfy, clean and thereâ€™s a good amount of seating. The kitchen does have a good share of utensils and plates, etc to prepare yourself meals.
The one bathroom is stocked with towels- would be better with some fabreez or aerosol bathroom spray ğŸ˜‚.
The doors self lock after you and are easy to operate.
Outside of the stairs, the only off putting thing are the multiple laminated signs with the rules, there are multiple on the stairs all over the kitchen/halls. Kinda gives a vibe of overbearing parents leaving kids at home. Now, obviously this shows care for the property, just from my pov isnâ€™t very welcoming.
Overall good experience and high-level communication.

name: Sheila
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
January 2022
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This adorable little cottage was absolutely perfect! The location is convenient to downtown, the inside is neat as a pin, and all the thoughtful touches made my stay feel like home instead of a generic hotel room.
The kitchen is ready for use with a full-sized fridge and stove, a 12-cup coffee maker and a single-cup coffee maker (coffee pods provided!) and enough dishes for everyone to enjoy a meal.
Plenty of fluffy towels in the bathroom, shampoo, conditioner and shower gel too was a nice touch.
All the beds were comfortable, with plenty of pillows and bedding for everyone.
The stairs to the second floor are a tad steep, but manageable, the motion-sensor light really is helpful.
Unfortunately, our visit was in winter so we did not enjoy the covered patio.
My favorite amenity however was the fireplace in the living room. So cozy!
I am so glad that I found this place for my visit to the Wabash. We have family in the area, and will certainly book another stay here.
Thank you for making our weekend trip memorable Kyle and Aubrey!

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Cute house & ideal location. We were alittle disappointed with the kitchen. The pans were very dirty & wouldn't come clean. So we just ended up going & buying a few to use while there. We saw a mouse & that was alittle nerve wracking. But not uncommon for a rural area I suppose. The stairs going up stairs are very narrow, steep & small. Not for everyone. My fibromylagia wasnt a fan at all. We ended up just staying downstairs. Not all of the lights have lightbulbs so they are more for looks & not function I guess. The water pressure in the shower is very weak. We usually have a different bnb that we stay at & wanted to try something new. Overall it was ok. There were signs for pets so if you travel with your pets then this would be a good place. Nice yard if you have kids or pets accompany with you. There is a bar across the street. Only Friday night were they loud enough to sorta be a bother. The rest of the time it was fine. Hosts seemed nice & communicated well. Otherwise all seemed ok.

There were extra keys so we could come and go independently of one another.
There was an ice maker and two dishwashers along with a huge refrigerator. Plenty of room to keep everything cold.
Took us a little time to figure out how to watch TV but we managed.
Would 100% rent again!
Be sure to read parking instructions carefully! I drove around the block a couple times to figure out there was virtually no parking on site. There was an â€œunloadingâ€ zone but we still had to haul our bags up the side walk to main level, the lower level was more convenient. The parking was about a block away across another parking lot.

Had an amazing stay. My wife and I stayed for our anniversary. This was a perfect little getaway for us. Not too far from home, and plenty to do in the surrounding area. We ventured out in the area and did some antique shopping in North Manchester, Roann, and Wabash (all short drives). My grandpa was born in 1926, in Largo, and very likely may have been in the general store that was here in the Riparian. He passed in 2003. The Riparian is a very neat piece of history brought back to life. We loved the little pieces of history preserved
or incorporated into the building along with the industrial style decor. Very cool place and it had everything we needed for our stay.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Riparian House is exactly as described. It is peaceful, quaint, and in a very old building dating back to the 1820â€™s that has been restored. If you are looking for night-life, keep looking as this house is in a small Indiana town that rolls up the sidewalks Come 9:00 pm. But if you are looking for hiking and biking trails, eagles nearby, a river out the back window, solitude, and a building with historical significance, this is the place. Riparian House is a studio with a huge bath and a fantastic shower, a great bed, and very soft and luxurious sheets and towels. There is a newer restaurant next door for lunch and dinner and the towns of Wabash and Huntington are a short distance for variety and groceries. The town of Lagro also has a Creamery and a Coffee Shop. My only issue during my stay was a wonky key box but Justin owns the Bistro next door so all I had to do was drop off the key at the restaurant. Beverly was quick to turn around questions relative to reservations.

What an amazing place in such a nice little town! Since our retirement, we have been traveling all over rural America riding our bikes. This was one of our best Adventures ever! The Riparian House, with such a rich history, and beautifully done renovations has been the coolest place we have stayed at to date. The local contact person, Justin, truly made us feel at home.
He operates the 950 Speakeasy Bistro, right next to the Riparian House. It was so convenient to get great food right next store and this also made for easy communications between us and our host. The little town has so much to offer. Jeremy, the owner of the Canal Creamery, even opened up for us on his closed days, so that we could get our daily fix of quality ice cream.
The other staff at the Speakeasy were incredibly friendly and attentive to our needs. Our rental was well equipped, clean, quiet and we felt totally safe staying here. It was a great place to launch our bike rides we had a great time there!

review_text:
If you're going to stay here be prepared for the pub next door. Rowdy crowd on Friday and Saturday nights. Pub goers don't mind parking in the reserved spot out back or hanging out in front of the room smoking either. Had to park down the street both Friday and Saturday night. Pub staff very inflexible when it comes to ordering food as I tried to order something to go and was informed by staffer that it's 9:02 and the kitchen closes at 9:00. This despite the pub being full of patrons and the cook clearly still preparing food. No breakfast available so they should drop one of the B's...
Now the good. Quiet and peaceful in the morning, and the coffee left by the host was most excellent. The one room is nice and clean. The little porch out back made for a perfect place to drink coffee and the trail head is right out the back door and across the street for a peaceful morning walk. Overall, I enjoyed the place, but was glad I had ear plugs for sleeping...

review_text:
This was to be an ancestral tour for me- visiting my fathers childhood stomping grounds and such. Beverly and Justin were available with recommendations on where to look for information. At the end of the stay we had found every house we wanted to see, ancestor grave AND we canoed the Wabash from Lagro to Wabash.
The Riparian House was the perfect landing pad. We stayed busy all day and slept peacefully 9-10 hours each night! Windows open, listening to the birds and the rain.
We are in awe of the amount of work that was put in to the restoration of this historic building. The added touch of sliding stained glass windows and the beautiful repurposing of an original door- amazing. You just need to see it yourself.
Friendly folks in Lagro. While out walking they smile, greet you and are open to a chat. That must be why my dad was always so approachable to all. It all makes sense to me now.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Space was very clean and cozy, and clearly a lot of thought and care was put into it's renovation. Checking in and out was easy (lockbox) and the instructions were simple. A couple of things to be aware of: there is a bar right next door with live music, and on Friday summer nights they have outdoor karaoke which is loud and lasts until at least 11pm. Because of that, there is a fair amount of street and motorcycle noise. We were only there on Friday and Saturday, so it might be better on weeknights. Also, people seem to have no qualms about walking through the yard, and the house is right next to the sidewalk so if you have the blinds open for natural light they can see right in - and they will look! If privacy is a priority for you, this is probably not the best place unless you want to keep the blinds closed at all times. Otherwise, we had a wonderful stay!

review_text:
This little Airbnb did not disappoint! Tucked away in the sleepy town of Lagro, which is on the edge of rebuilding, was just the quiet I was looking for. Seriously it is so quiet & has a positive energy around it.
From the deck &/or the patioâ€¦ Bike trail & Wabash River. The Speak Easy Bistro on one side & a great story teller on the other(He builds airplanes & sculpts)
A strong stoneâ€™s throw to a boat launch for canoes/kayaks. Just a 3 min. drive to Hanging Rock (Great story) & Salamonie Lake/Dam. Just 10min to Wabash for great local flavor shops, terrific coffee shop & fine dining options. (â€œTwentyâ€ has amazing salmon)
The pics donâ€™t do the inside justice. The details and craftsmanship makes it obvious how much love went into this place.
The outlets have USB ports- plenty of lighting, a beautiful drape for a little separation of bedroom, should you need it. The AC/Heating unit was SUPER quiet & worked to keep the place very comfortable.
I felt safe exercising early morning and walking late evenings Thur-Sunday.
The trees will keep you from catching the sunrise, so head over to the community boat launch /fire pit/big table if you want to get your day started with the sun. Those trees sure are wonderful at night, leaves blowing in the wind and the river & birds chiming in like an orchestra performance from nature.
I will be adding more dates to my calendar to visit again! (River shoes & beach towel on my list)
If you see Roger, two doors down, ask him about building planes- he can tell you stories for hours (Tell him Karrie sent youâ€¦for a story)

If you have kids, check out the Salamonie Interpretive Center, it was $7 and included the wildflower garden and access to a huge beachfront of the resovoir. The kids could have spent the whole trip there! Very kid and pet friendly trip!

review_text:
If you are looking for a "country" getaway, away from the sounds of the city, cars and people, you will thoroughly enjoy this spot. All the many reviews have essentially said this, which was our experience- its so peaceful. You are surrounded for miles by farm land. There is a great view of the horse paddock and fields and farms in the distance right out the window. For city people, its a real getaway. Its super cozy, with two bedrooms above the living area in a loft type space with sloping somewhat low ceilings.
The important stuff like A/C works great and seems new. Kitchen and baths were roomy, clean and nicely decorated. Wifi as others touched on is a little spotty but works. I wouldn't relying on it to try and work remotely though.
We also enjoyed being able to walk directly from the yard into trails. We tried two, one behind the owners house, which led quickly to near the reservoir but the trail -maybe due to rhe weather may have been better on horse back- it was blocked by standing water that was hard to traverse on foot and very muddy. The second trail from the yard directly behind the paddock was a much more pleasant walk- still through rough grass so you may need hiking shoes- but led around farm land and state forest that was very enjoyable.
The town of Lagro has a portion of a bike trail that is not yet complete that will connect to Wabash and further. (See Wabash river trail Facebook page).
As the listing mentions stores and restaurants are closed Sunday (and we discovered Mondays too). So get groceries either at Kroger or walmart or a single family run grocery all in Wabash and open Sundays.
The town of Wabash is small with alot of history and the downtown has alot of charm- and the town and county are working on "revitalizing" with new stores and restaurants. The old book store on the main street is an absolute must for anyone enjoying that. The resale boutique Bellazo was excellent with a much better "curated" selection of clothes than "used" sounds and trendy gifts and tshirts. The restaurant Harrys, a mile or so from downtown was, on Monday night, a great local spot with really excellent food and beer selection.

**We would 100% stay here again**
PROS:

- House was immaculate. Very clean & organized.
- Easy, free street parking right in front. Was perfect!
CONS:
- The only complaint I have is the noise. We could hear the upstairs tenant walking around for hours in the middle of the night. It was loud enough that it kept waking us up so we hardly slept. That said, it wouldn't prevent us from staying here again. I just thought I'd bring it up especially if you're a light sleeper. Just bring ear plugs! :)

review_text: Delightful stay, I would give 10 stars if it was possible. It is affordable, rooms were spacious and super clean. review_text: This is a very roomy, comfortable, clean and restful place to stay! With a neutral color palette and minimal extraneous decor, we felt calm and easy there. We came to Wabash for a family wedding that had a lot of tension and moving parts. It was very nice to go back to this lovely, quiet home in between wedding events to rest and recharge. All of the beds are very comfortable, the towels see soft and fluffy, there are plenty of drawers, cabinets and closets for everything!! The living room sofas and chairs are big and soft, the huge-screened TV is great!! There are a few steps you must climb to get to the front porch, but after you are in the door, the entire unit is on one level. The hosts are quick with communication replies and answers to questions. We barely even heard the guests in the upstairs unit, the house is well insulated and the AC and Heater work perfectly. We will book again when visiting Wabash in the future!

This would be a great getaway for couples as there were several books/games available to re-get to know each other and share with each other. I would definitely recommend this location for couples. We found antiques and oddities, a covered bridge, a waterfall, ice cream, and a great bar for hamburgers and rings! Plus, it has been decades since I won a game of Battleship! Truly enjoyed our stay and the story/pictures of how this place came to be. Thank you, Kurt and Heidi!

review_text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Shed Retreat. It was evident that a lot of care and thought has gone into making this little space as comfortable and welcoming as possible. For us, this stay checked all of our boxes, particularly being simple and affordable. The bathroom situation (toilet and shower outdoors) was no problem for us, and even added to the fun of our stay. I found myself especially appreciative of the house robes and shoes provided for our use - they made walking to the bathroom or using the shower a lot cleaner and easier than it could have been. Although we didn't meet Kurt and Heidi face to face during our stay, they were always quick to respond to questions, and available to help. I could certainly see us staying at the Shed Retreat again in the future. As parents it was the perfect little space to get away and reconnect for a couple days, without breaking the budget. We really appreciate what Kurt and Heidi have done with the space, and love that they've made it available.

The shed itself was warm, inviting and smelled wonderful inside. The hosts leave you to your own devices and honor privacy, while still responding quickly to communication through the Airbnb app. The toilet arrangement (a camp toilet outside and one you can take inside) most certainly isnâ€™t for everyone. It was a little hard to handle at times, but certainly didnâ€™t take away from my total experience. Also, because of the time of year, the outdoor shower on premises was not available (there are showers available at a local rec facility for a modest fee). If you can put up with these minor points, I would enthusiastically recommend this location to anyone visiting this area!

The kittens sat in my lap purring me awake the next morning while enjoying coffee out front on the deck. Kurt and Heidi hit the nail on the head with the details of my new escape. They pray for those who find their way to the Shed. And pray for you while youâ€™re here. And my soul could feel their healing words. Thank you so much for sharing this sacred space.

name: Jean
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
September 2021
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The Shed Retreat is a little room in a beautifully peaceful setting out in the country. It's kind of a cross between a guest cottage and camping. The Shed itself is relatively close to Kurt & Heidi's house, yet is situated so it's surprisingly secluded and private, so it really IS perfect for a retreat.
Personally, my favorite part about my 2-night stay was probably just sitting inside, reading, writing, and coloring, with the windows open to let in the cool, fresh air. I also enjoyed an evening campfire (ate too many s'mores), walking down to the creek and the green grassy area (early a.m. squats & lunges), gathering fresh eggs, and practicing some "kitten yoga" (didn't know that was a thing, but the little grey guy thought I should try it).
The outside restroom is relatively convenient, clean, and comfortable. I feel that guests should be aware in advance that they are asked to do some of their own "maintenance" of the camp toilet, and that was not at all a problem for me.
Heidi and Kurt went out of their way to help me with a problem that came up (which was not related to their property), and I'm so appreciative of their assistance.
I didn't experience much in the town of North Manchester, but I did visit the History Museum, which was interesting and informative, and the Main View restaurant where I had a delicious lunch.
I hope I get an opportunity to stay at The Shed sometime in the future!

The chickens, fresh eggs and adorable kitties just added to the charm of the experience. Price was right and well worth it! Thanks Kurt and Heidi!

Â·
Stayed one night
review_text: If you like "glamping" this place is for you! It was an oasis of serenity and beauty, nestled in a sweet garden of hostas and shady trees. The chickens are near the parking and their sweet soft noises greeted us as we entered the very short path to the beautiful converted goat shed. If those goats could see this place now, they'd be in awe of it! The decor inside is darling and it had everything you needed, including A/C, electricity, a nice comfy chair, coffee table and love seat sitting area. The large bed was extremely comfy and the pillows were perfect. Rubber slippers, towels and bathrobes were provided near the back door for use in the very private outside shower. There is a camp toilet which along with the foot pump sink is part of the "glamping" experience that made this a fun adventure. From the cupcakes that greeted us to the fresh eggs we cooked in the barn for breakfast, we couldn't have asked for more! Oh! We also were over the moon visiting with the sweetest momma cat and her five adorable kittens!!! If we could have adopted any, we would have begged for at least two. It will be one of the best places you can find to stay in Indiana and I guarantee you won't want to leave!

review_text: Kurt and Heidi were wonderful hosts! We loved relaxing in the hammocks, spending time by the campfire, and getting fresh eggs from the coop! There were so many small touches that made the trip extra special too--like a welcome note with homemade cookies and a note on a book of questions inviting us to get to know each other better. My wife fell in love with Nala, one of their kittens, who was a great hammock snuggle buddy! Kurt was especially attentive and communicative--transporting our farmer's market goods (There is a wonderful farmer's market in town on Saturday mornings!) for us when he noticed that we had bought a little too much to carry back with us to the shed with the bikes that he lent us. We also really enjoyed, and recommend, the kayaking trip! (This would be at a small extra cost and includes kayaks, paddles, life jackets and drop off / pick up.) It was all just what we needed to get away from everyday life!

Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This place was an amazing retreat into nature and simple living. If you need to clear your mind, get in touch with yourself, focus on art or meditation; this is the place for you. The hosts were so kind and the amenities were unbelievable for the price and quality of the place. I recommend bringing your own grill and food to cook on site. There is a great farmers market in the town on Saturday morning, but otherwise healthy convenient food choices are slim. The camping toilet is really the only rustic part of the amenities so you should be prepared to take care of your own waste. There are some beautiful state parks in the area you can drive to for hiking trails and nature time. The best part by far was meeting the hosts and going on the kayak adventure; they provided the kayak and the drop-off/pick-up. The river was beautiful with a good mix of challenging and relaxing sections which made for a perfect true adventure. Thank you so much Heidi and Kurt for the love and kindness you put into this retreat.

The house location in Wabash is unbeatable. There is a playground across the street, Downtown is walking distance, as well as the best Mexican restaurant I've ever been to. A paved Riverwalk trail is close by. There's also a gas station and car wash nearby, and grocery stores are within 10 minutes. If you're visiting Wabash, this is definitely the place to stay.

It was super clean and had a delightfully cool temperature inside! Was very hot and humid out during our stay and we were impressed how well the silo stayed cool. Keishia sent several emails the day we were to arrive to ensure we had proper directions, info to get into the house, etc. Was a perfect little property and exactly what we wanted for our getaway.

review_text: The Bunkhouse was a cute and cozy little place to spend a quick night before a long day hiking the Salamonie trails. Keishia was very communicative and the arrival/check-in process was super easy. The accommodations are adorable and they did an impressive job fitting all the basics into the renovated grain silo. The ranch is beautiful but they do not allow you to go anywhere beyond the immediate area of the Bunkhouse. We would love to come again and get there a little earlier next time so we could have a fire and spend more time on the porch before the bugs come out. If you are a late riser (like us), make sure you note the 10am check-out.

Finding the place was easy as well - you can see the silo just inside the ranch entrance from the main road intersection. The living quarters were quaint and adorable and yet fit all of the amenities and comforts of home away from home. Would stay again and highly recommend this experience!

review_text:
My fiancÃ©e and I wanted a place where we could escape from the world. When I found Loveâ€™s Hideaway Ranch, I felt like I hit the jack-pot. It's the middle of a quiet countryside in rural Indiana, and it's a tiny-home: perfect for us because it had everything we needed to be comfortable for 4 nights while also being much more affordable than a larger house wouldâ€™ve been (a full kitchen and bathroom indoors, a cozy living room with a TV, and a loft with a comfortable bed).
We found that it felt even roomier inside than the photos led on. The kitchen, living room, bathroom, and loft were more than big enough for the two of us. The deck outside was a great touch, and made â€œyourâ€ space feel that much bigger, while maintaining the cozy, tiny-home feel.
Lagro is just 5 min up the road for any convenience store needs, and should you need anything more than that, Wabash is 15 min further.
All in all, Loveâ€™s Hideaway Ranch was true to its name: a place to hide away from the world.

review_text:
Our stay was quiet and relaxing. We spent our days at local disc golf courses; there are several very good ones within a 25-mile radius. For our evenings, we know that streaming videos out on country internet service is not as seamless as it is in the city, so we brought in a small table to play card/board games. We had just enough room to set it up, and it made for some great evenings of Everdell, Terraforming Mars, and even some Skip-Bo.
If you're looking for wide-open, spacious rooms and excellent video streaming services, this isn't the cabin for you. But if you're looking for quiet, private, cozy, easy check-in and parking, and lots of nearby outdoor amenities (hiking, biking, disc golf, sight seeing), you'll love it here!

review_text: The house is so cute and the property is very nice. The grain bin home is more spacious than you'd think with lots of room for your luggage. There is a full kitchen with all types of appliances and cooking utensils, and a full bathroom with a shower and towels. I am 5'5" and I did not need to duck in the main part of the loft, but anyone taller than that will need to. It is a fairly big loft with a very comfortable bed. The property has very nice walking paths through the trees (bring some boots if it has rained recently). Within a short drive, there are plenty of waterfalls and various fun places to explore if you have any extra time! Overall, it was a wonderful stay and I will definitely be back!

name: Tim
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
October 2021
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Such a wonderful property and a unique stay! We loved all of the following: the forest trails to explore (on my runs I came across 5 deer), the cute farm animals (the cows seem to enjoy us watching them), the SUPER comfortable bed, the excellent heating/cooling, the close proximity to natural attractions (so many waterfalls), and the kind extras (such as providing new dry firewood after rain soaked the previous batch and an eclectic selection of movies on DVD). We had such a relaxing getaway as a couple and felt renewed for our return home.
A few notes so others can be aware (and none of these are deal-breakers...we definitely plan to return). This is a remote location, so you will have to deal with some of what that entails, including:
slower than usual wi-fi connections over satellite - (Netflix will still stream, but may occasionally be blurry or pause)
well water - the smell takes some getting used to after taking a shower or flushing the toilet, but the filter on the sink faucet improves the taste.
We also really appreciated that the property allows dogs (for a deposit). Be warned though if you have a small dog that they could easily slide underneath the railing and drop one floor to the ground. Ours jumped off the bed, slid some on the wood floor, and nearly fell off the edge. It is not the safest property for a small dog (or child), so if you book this, be prepared to move things around and possibly setup some luggage blockades to make it safe.
These are all minor inconveniences, but really this property rocks, and is one of the most unique AirBNBs we have stayed at. It is tiny, but featured-filled, feels like the middle of nowhere (but is close to waterfalls, Lagro, and Wabash), has fantastic farm-life and trails, and has a kind host who is committed to making your stay convenient and comfortable. We highly recommend and hope to return in the future!

name: Carolyn
rating_info:

,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The silo is absolutely adorable, and located in a lovely, rural settimg. The cute cows mooing outside the window are the icing on the cake. The trails on the property were dotted with flowers when we were there, and the scents along the trail kept our rescue dog very involved in our explorations! We were lucky enough to be there when a brief thunderstorm rolled through, and the sounds inside the silo were incredible!
Keishia was very sweet, willing to accomodate our larger dog (we asked before booking), and communicated incredibly well before and throughout our stay.
On a practical level:
Check-in with the lock box was convenient (but be careful not to drop the key down between the door and the deck, as I almost did!)
The air conditioning works very well, and kept the small space cool even when the heat index was near 100
The washer/dryer combo is efficient and well located.
The shower pressure is great, but if you're a bit squishy (like me and my husband), you may find it a bit of a squeeze compared to what you're used to at home. Not a big deal, but something to be aware of. Shampoo, conditioner, body wash, hand soap,lots of nice quality toilet paper, a clean toilet, and a large stack of towels help make the bathroom practical and comfy.
Everything was very clean, well organized, and the kitchen had all the essentials for cooking a meal (including a pizza cutter, cookie sheets, and a variety of spoons, spatulas and pancake flippers). I only regret that I didn't bring stuff to make cookies in the cute little oven! Both a Keurig and traditional coffee pot are available and there were coffee filters on the shelf when we were there.
We highly recommend this property to anyone who needs a little quiet time away, or wants to be near Wabash, but in a more rural setting, or who just wants to try out tiny house living to see if it's right for them! If you're a fan of quiet nature settings, gorgeous sunsets, and happy neighborly cows, this is the place to be.

,
Â·
Stayed one night
review_text: A compassionate host would have made a huge difference for me and my sister. We were on a sister's trip to make memories since my sister is disable, walks with a cane, and has debilitating side effects from battling cancer. Aware that the airbnb was non-smoking, I wanted to be considerate and respectful so I reached out to Beverly to make sure it would be okay for my disable sister to smoke outside on the porch, screened in patio, or even in the yard. Beverly was quite rude in her response by saying that IF SHE MUST smoke that she could only stand and smoke in the driveway or in my car. She proceeded to tell us how much she had spent on the renovation. Personally, I don't care how much it cost. All she needed to say was politely no or that my sister could smoke outside. Again, you don't know who is on the other end ... so don't assume. Additionally, we are charged a cleaning fee; thus, we didn't squeegee the shower for you to 'make the host' happy. We won't be back!!

The proprieter met us at check in and gave us a walk through and short history of this amazing cottage. The pictures really don't do it justice! Bev and Jon are excellent hosts and have literally renovated the cottage as if they were going to live there.
Great location in Wabash just a block past the North Side Fire Station (don't worry, the station isn't busy.) Minutes from downtown, the hospital, fast food or sit down restaurants.
